CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: CHAPEL Seating capacity of 300. One of the largest auditoriums in Western Pennsylvania.  The Chapel is fitted in grand piano, organ and electric controlled music.  The entire establishment is free to those whom are bereaved... THE FUNERAL services may be held in the home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired.- Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa."
TitMainTitle: Chapel in Gaines Funeral Home with wooden chairs in foreground, altar with podium, cross, stained glass, plants, and large pipe organ in background
